comment: He is a pretty good choice for BSTAT. I didnt take stat 1401 before this class but he made the class really easy to follow. He records all his lectures, and records himself going over the practice exams and excel projects which makes it a lot easier to do them. His class is heavily Excel-based. While other bstat classes do calculations by hand.

Records lectures. 3 tests consist of three parts (Concepts, Problems, Excel Project) with an optional final, and he records the test review for each and walks through them all. 2 quizzes due every monday. No attendance, but might do attendance next semester. I took STATS 1401 at the same time which helped me understand concepts in this class
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Take Professor D! Tests are super easy - just like practice exams. You get 4 attempts on the chapter quizzes, hard to fail unless you're stupid. Posts lectures so I stopped coming to class like 2 weeks in. He's also super sweet and knowledgeable

THE EXCEL PROJECTS ARE SO HARD. The tests are easy, I got a 100 on every concept and problem exam, but the excel projects make or break that. They are hard to understand how to complete. However, he is great at explaining things. Compared to my friend's professors, he is amazing for business statistics.

This is one of the most difficult courses at Coles College, but I got an A in everything due to the amazing resources provided by the professor. I recommend you review everything to death and attend every lecture in person if possible. Exams are 3 parts, Excel, Concepts & Problems around 8-10 questions each. If you review carefully you'll be fine.

Prof.D is one of the nicest professors I have ever had. He cares about your success and likes to crack jokes throughout his lectures. The class has almost weekly online quizzes, but 4 attempts. As long as you give any effort you'll pass with ease. The excel projects can be tough at times, but follow his guided video and you'll do great

Take him!! This class is difficult no matter who you take. He posts all lectures on D2L so if you're confused you can rewatch them however many times you need. He clearly goes over how to do everything, would highly recommend him.

Great!! No complaints. Did exactly what was needed. He is very sweet and teaches great. He recorded and posted our class each day and everything we did in class, including his work when teaching the math/excel functions was posted as well. Great Teacher

Three tests are 30% each, and quizzes are the other 10%. That being said, he has to be the best BStat professor there is. There's a concepts, problems, and Excel portion of each test, with all but the concepts being open note. He explains everything and uses Excel with you to solve problems instead of by hand. Take him.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE HIM FOR ECON 3300 or any class tbh. This is by far the most difficult class for business students and I'm pretty sure it has the highest drop rate for any class in the business school. Professor D makes class super easy and understandable. You can watch every lecture online and he posts them on D2L. Do yourself a favor and take his class.

Stopped going to class for health reasons but i followed his recorded lectures on teams. He is so amazing and caring. He wants you to succeed and learn the content. Content gets hard in the second half of the semester so buckle up for that. I plan on taking him again for econ 3300

Professor Dodonova is really laid back. His 2300 class consists of online chapter quizzes every Sunday that are easy to do well on. He post every lecture online in Teams. Attendance is NOT required at all. Theres 3 tests throughout the semester and he goes over step by step what to do on the excel portions of the exams. Would highly recommend.

He obviously knows what he is talking about when it comes to statistics and the logic behind statistics. Unsure how his full term classes are but I took a summer class with him and it seemed as if there were not enough grades.

He stuck to the syllabus. The gradebook was 90% tests and 10% quizzes. The tests weren't too bad; however, each test had three seperate parts, an excel project, a concepts test, and a problems test. He records lectures and posts them on d2l. Overall, he was a pretty good professor.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment:
TLDR: Few grades, fast grader, very helpful lectures.

Graded by 3 tests and weekly homework quizzes, final is optional. Professor D is very willing to help you understand every topic and responds quickly to emails. Tests and projects were always graded within 3 days of the due date.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: The concept and problem quizzes are vital to help prepare for the tests. He also provides practice and does it in class if there is extra time. He was extremely open to helping students and thoroughly explained material as he taught. Spend time doing practice problems for the test and you should do well. Genuinely a great professor and course

You have three tests that are consisted of 3 parts: concepts, problems, and an excel project where each are worth 10 points so each unit test is 30 points. Also consists of weekly quizzes that, in total, are 10 points and he also offers an optional final that replaces lowest test grade. He was okay. Really nice, but makes you work for it.

He is an amazing teacher. I was a bit scared because its heavy on math but he provides EVERYTHING and more in order to understand. He always posted the recorded lectures, recorded lecture slides, and practice problems. Such an amazing professor, as long as you try then he is more than willing to help.

Although this course is challenging, the professor made it easy to get an A as long as you put in the effort. Took it over the summer, so if you're not great at math, I do not recommend. 1 discussion, 1 excel exam, 3 tests, 1 final, 11 chapter quizzes. Do the work, ask for help, you will pass. Don't wait til last minute to start your homework.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall, great professor. Every time I emailed him, he responded quickly and willing to help. VERY accommodating and understanding. I am an A-B student, however, stats/math is my weakness. 3 Tests and 18 quizzes. Tests is split into 2 parts: Concept portion and Problem portion, 10 questions each. Final is optional and replaces your lowest test.

Wouldn't recommend over the summer unless you're great with statistics. Weekly quizzes that are easy enough if you go to class complete them all it can help your grade or kill it. Excel assignments are done in class before due date. He teaches off his notes so textbook is optional. Tests are concepts (hard) + problems (open notes). Come to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Nice professor but does not help you understand the material. A few times I asked for help with understanding the material and he told me to review his notes and powerpoint slides as well as do the online quizzes. When I told him I do all of those things, he still didn't help. He only has about 6 major grades and quizzes are 0.5 points each.

Great professor!!! The material was pretty easy. Just go to class and you can't fail. Two quizzes a week, and 3 tests with an optional final. No need for the book as he provides detailed notes. Take him for business stats!!

One of the best teachers Ive ever taking in my life. Very organized & his notes are very detail, they go step by step on how to do d problems. The class is hard but if you follow his notes & go to class, you can get an A. Tests r usually 10 mul. choice q's closed book & 5 problem show your work questions open book, notes and computer and cal.

DON'T BUY THE BOOK ITS A WASTE. He explains everything on the notes where you don't have to buy the book! There are 3 (60 points) tests are worth 20 pts each (10 pts (multiple choice)/10 (problems but you can use all kinds of sources), 2 take home tests, a bonus test (5 points) and an optional final (only if you're passing) & up to 20 points on HW.

Class is tough. A lot of content. Make sure early on you start learning his "doublespeak" ie. Sample mean can be called sample mean or XBar or the Greek symbol. He goes fast so if you are not up to speed he will give you trouble. I think he's good, very helpful. Just a tough class. I had no issues with his accent.
BEST TEACHER!!! I couldnt ask for a better professor. He is extremely nice and helpful. If you have the chance to take him... DONT MISS IT!!

The teacher was not necessarily easy, but gave you the opporunity.  His test weren't hard at all and in fact were half open note.  He is hard to understand, but very nice.  He is interested in helping you succeed. I reccommend him.
Gives a lot of extra credit and didn't have to buy book.

The subject is not easy but the teacher allows notes for a portion of the test and he is willing to help you in his office if you need further help. Love the teacher & learnt from the class. Great Prof!

This teacher is very very hard to understand. Not only due to his strong accent, but because he is still not completely fluent in english and often stumbles over his words. He does not curve test grades and has quizzes right after you learn each chapter, before you have a chance to soak in the material. I am an A student and barely made a C

Business stats gives you the formulas and you apply them.  Prof is excellent: easy to understand, great sense of humor, and gives you all the tools to do well in class including concise notes. Advantage if you have a laptop, excel and USE it. Highly recommend this prof, I?d take him again.

This is a hard subject you must study in order to understand the material. But he does allow on notes on tests and he offers bonus points. On the other hand he is strict about grading test. Overall he's a good teacher to have.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!! he is so hard to understand and is totally unfair when it comes to grading!!! If you are not prepared to study 10+ hours for each test do not take him.

Awesome Teacher! A little hard to understand with the accent...but very helpful and will repeat something if you didn't hear it the first time.  The subject is very hard, however he lets you use book and notes for test.  There are also many ways to get bonus points for test! There is no way you could take this class with this teacher and not pass!
